titles.title: National Security and Classified Information Protection Act of 1995
To amend title 18, United States Code, to make the knowing disclosure of classified information by Federal officers and employees a criminal offense.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. National Security and Classified Information Protection Act of 1995 - Amends the Federal criminal code to make the knowing disclosure of classified information to an unauthorized person by present and former Federal officials and employees a criminal offense.
